speaker: Frasier
text: All right, if you must know, I'm just about to leave for something called a "speed date."

speaker: Roz
text: What's a speed date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, apparently it's the latest thing: twelve men and twelve women get together in a room.  They spend eight minutes talking to one other and then move on to the next person after a bell rings.  Basically, it's all the stress and humiliation of a blind date... times twelve.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, talk about desperate.  So what brought this on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm just so tired of being surrounded by happy couples, I just thought I should do something a bit more proactive.

speaker: Roz
text: You wouldn't be talking about Niles and Daphne, would you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, among others.  Believe me, no one could be happier for Niles than I, but there are days when his lovesick swain act wears the tiniest bit thin. _Niles walks up.  He is carrying a shopping bag and his jacket.  He is wearing a t-shirt (!) that has a heart-shaped picture of Daphne and him on it surrounded by red hearts.  He has a huge grin on his face._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Niles
text: Notice anything different?

speaker: Roz
text: I like it.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  I've never worn an undergarment in public before.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that my sweater?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, here.  What's the emergency?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, I was going out this evening and I was thinking about changing my attire.  While the suit projects a certain professionalism, you know "Dr. Frasier Crane," I was thinking perhaps  the sweater could impart a more casual feel, "Just Fraizh." [_He holds the sweater up._] Any thoughts?

speaker: Roz
text: [_after a beat, she turns to Niles_] So I bet you and Daphne have big Valentine's Day plans.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes.  She's cooking dinner for me and then I've a big surprise planned.  I'm taking her to Cancun for a long romantic weekend.

speaker: Roz
text: Not bad!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I'm whisking her to the airport in a limo filled with exotic orchids.  You don't think that's a too over the top, do you?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I think that boat sailed with your t-shirt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here's an idea: what if put the sweater under the jacket? Then I'll get the best of both worlds.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising_] Honestly, Frasier, could you be more self-absorbed? Goodbye, Roz.  If you want to know more about our trip, we'll have pictures on our website when we get back. _He leaves.  Roz turns back to Frasier who is still fussing with the sweater._

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, for God's sake, Frasier, flip a coin.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know this may seem like nothing to you, Roz, but the tiniest decision can shape your whole destiny.  So, which path should I follow? [_He begins raising and lowering the sweater in front of himself._] Sweater?  Suit.  Sweater? Suit.  Sweater?

speaker: Roz
text: [_grabbing her head_] Oh just pick one!

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, you're right.  Okay, fine.  We'll go with... the suit.

speaker: Roz
text: You made the right choice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wish me luck. _He starts to walk out, but bumps into a man (Mike) getting up from a stool at the counter._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Pardon me.  Say, don't you work at KACL?

speaker: Mike
text: Yeah, I just started.  Mike Schafer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Mike.  Frasier Crane.  Have you met Roz Doyle?

speaker: Mike
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you are new, aren't you?

speaker: Roz
text: Can I buy you a cup of coffee? _Frasier again turns to leave.  However, a young woman (Monica) spills a cup of coffee as she hands it to a waitress is holding and jumps up, backing her chair into him and knocking him to the floor._

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, my god.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!  Are you okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I - ow!  Gosh, I think I've wrenched my shoulder.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, I am so sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's all right.  Ow!

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, I'm taking you to the emergency room.  Please, it's the least I can do.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I have my car right outside, I'll take you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, don't you have coffee waiting? [_He turns to Monica._] Hi, I'm Frasier.

speaker: Monica
text: I'm... Monica.  You must think I'm such a klutz!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not at all. _They exit and then the entire scene SLIDES to the right and we are back at the point where Frasier is deciding on his attire. (UNIVERSE 2)_

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, for God's sake, Frasier, flip a coin.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know this may seem like nothing to you, Roz, but the tiniest decision can shape your whole destiny.  So, which path should I follow? [_He begins raising and lowering the sweater in front of himself._] Sweater?  Suit.  Sweater?  Suit.  Sweater?

speaker: Roz
text: [_grabbing her head_] Oh just pick one!

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, you're right.  We'll go with... the suit. _He puts the sweater back in the bag and rises, then puts it back on the chair._

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, the sweater.

speaker: Roz
text: You made the right choice. _Mike gets up, not running into Frasier, but colliding with Monica as she spills the cup and jumps up._

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, my God, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Mike
text: That's okay, no harm done.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, what a klutz.  All right, Roz, wish me luck.

speaker: Roz
text: Good luck!

speaker: Mike
text: Mike Schaefer.  Looks like you're gonna need another cup of coffee.

speaker: Monica
text: Uh, yeah. **TWO ROADS DIVERGED... AND I TOOK THEM BOTH**  _Scene Two - A Hospital Examination Room -- UNIVERSE 1 Fade in. Frasier is sitting on the exam table, his arm in a sling.  Monica is with him. _

speaker: Monica
text: You know, you're not the first guy I've sent to the emergency room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Monica
text: When I was ten my brother fell off my handlebars and broke his foot.  Then, in art school, a pottery wheel got away from me and sort of rolled down some stairs and I broke one guy's knee and another guy's hip.

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose after that you went on a kiln spree.

speaker: Monica
text: Uh, yeah.  I guess you could say I've broken more than my share of bones.

speaker: Frasier
text: And more than your fair share of hearts, I'm sure.

speaker: Monica
text: I don't know about that.

speaker: Monica
text: Frasier, I am so sorry about your arm.  I hope I haven't ruined your plans.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, actually, I didn't have anything special planned. _The scene SLIDES to the uninjured Frasier in the midst of the speed date, talking to a woman (Judy) -- UNIVERSE 2 _

speaker: Judy
text: Hey, have you heard about the new pirate movie?  It's rated "Aarr!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's very droll.

speaker: Judy
text: Get it?  Aarr!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I do.

speaker: Judy
text: That's sort of my test joke, you know, to see if a guy's cool or not?  Can you believe it, you're the first guy here who laughed?  I mean, can't you just see it: a pirate walks into a movie theater, he's got his eye patch and his peg leg and...

speaker: Judy
text: Boy that did not feel like eight minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_dripping irony_] Indeed it did not. _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment -- UNIVERSE 2 Fade in. Martin is watching a movie on TV.  Frasier (uninjured) comes in the front. _

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras!  How did that speed date thing go?

speaker: Frasier
text: It could not have been worse.

speaker: Martin
text: That's nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're not listening, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Son.  Well, you get any phone numbers?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but if I ever want to track any of them down, I can always write them, care of... the bottom of the barrel.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, that's too bad. _Frasier opens the door to reveal Daphne who is holding three bags of groceries._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Daphne.  Let me give you a hand with that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're really loadin' up, aren't you?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's for Niles' Valentine's dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's not 'til next week.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, but it's a complicated recipe.  I need to practice. You two are going to be my guinea pigs.

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe we can fake our own deaths.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?  Are you planning on using cumin in this recipe?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, the recipe calls for lots of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord, Niles is terribly allergic to cumin.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear.  I knew about the scallops.  And the nutmeg, the oat bran, wheat germ, carob, parchment mites...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I know.  He tried to wearing an allergy tag, but his neck was too weak to support it.

speaker: Martin
text: [_rising_] D'you see that?  The character in this movie dialed the phone and at the exact same time, our phone rang.  It's like Montgomery Cliff's callin' me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's fascinating, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?  Oh, hey, Niles.  [_he looks towards the kitchen_] No, she can't hear.  Ah, geez.  I don't know about that.  Well, all right, if it means that much to you, I'll do it.  Yeah, bye.

speaker: Martin
text: That was your brother.  He wants me to pack a suitcase for Daphne for her trip to Cancun.  Now I'm gonna have to go through her unmentionables.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wonder if I'll ever see another unmentionable.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, come on, Frasier, it was just one bad date.

speaker: Frasier
text: It was twelve bad dates.  And a hundred before that. [_he lightly plays the piano and starts singing_] I'm through with love... I'll never call again...

speaker: Martin
text: You're gonna be like this all night, aren't you? [_to Daphne_] It breaks my heart to see him like this.  Fortunately, I can't see him from McGinty's. _He heads for the door and the scene SLIDES to Frasier, his arm in a sling, entering the apartment -- UNIVERSE 1 _

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Fras!  How did that speed date thing go?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I didn't go, Dad.  I went to the hospital instead.

speaker: Martin
text: That's nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you're not listening.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry son. [_he turns and sees Frasier's arm_] What happened?  Are you all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I tripped and sprained my shoulder, but I'm actually feeling no pain because I met a beautiful young woman.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, is she a nurse?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, she's the girl that tripped me.  Her name is Monica, she's a commercial artist, she's cute as a button, and she's a danger to herself and others.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Could you give me a hand here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I would, except I sprained my shoulder. [_she looks at Martin_]

speaker: Martin
text: Bullet in the hip.

speaker: Daphne
text: You still have one good arm, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: The doctor told me to take it easy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I met a girl today!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_heading to the kitchen_] Yeah, so did she.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what?  It might be a bit soon, but I think I'm gonna give Monica a call.

speaker: Martin
text: [_rising_] D'you see that?  The character in this movie dialed the phone and at the exact same moment, our phone rings. It's like Montgomery Cliff's callin' me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say hello to him for me.

speaker: Martin
text: Hello?  Oh, hey, Niles. [_he looks towards the kitchen_] No, she can't hear. ... Ah, geez.  I don't know about that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Monica.  Yeah, injured anybody lately? [_he laughs_] Really? I was calling because I thought maybe we could have dinner tomorrow night.  I don't know, maybe we could meet at Cafe Nervosa around seven and go from there?  Wonderful.  Great. I'll see you tomorrow.  Goodnight.

speaker: Frasier
text: She said "Yes"!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!

speaker: Frasier
text: Tomorrow night, I have a date with an angel!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you're gonna be like this all night, aren't you?

speaker: Daphne
text: McGinty's?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm way ahead of you. _They head for the door.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene One - Cafe Nervosa -- UNIVERSE 1 Fade in. Frasier (his arm in a sling) is having coffee with Roz. _

speaker: Frasier
text: So we had dinner again on Thursday night, and then again on Friday.  She had plans with her parents on Saturday, so, to keep our streak alive, I actually sent her a videotape of me eating and talking into the camera.

speaker: Roz
text: That's cute!

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't think it's a little too much?

speaker: Roz
text: No.  If you like her, go for it.

speaker: Frasier
text: So how are things with Mike?

speaker: Roz
text: Good.  He's taking me to the Heart Association benefit for Valentine's Day.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm going too.  You know Roz, I think this a first: you and I in happy relationships at the same time.

speaker: Monica
text: Hey, Roz.  Hi Frasier.  How's your head?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Uh, it's better actually.  My peripheral vision's coming back.

speaker: Monica
text: [_laughing_] Oh, good.  So sorry.  Listen, everyone at work's talking about the beautiful flowers you sent me.  Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait 'til you see what's coming next.  You won't be able to thank me in public.

speaker: Monica
text: Frasier, I hate to break it to you, but you don't have to keep sending me flowers and poetry.  You officially have my attention.

speaker: Monica
text: I'm gonna get some coffee.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, let me get that for you.

speaker: Monica
text: No.  You're sweet, but I think I can get my own coffee.

speaker: Roz
text: Looks like all that hard work you've been doing is paying off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not about to let up now.  I never want her to feel as if she's being taken for granted.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow.  You're giving Niles a run for his money.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please.  In the great golden book of love, Niles will be a mere footnote to my glorious saga.  I'm gonna take his ball and run it to the end zone. [_then, nervously_] Is that a thing?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good. **THE MOST MAGICAL NIGHT OF THE YEAR**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment -- UNIVERSE 2 Fade in. Frasier (uninjured) is sitting on the couch in jeans and a sweatshirt, eating a bag of potato chips and watching TV.  Martin comes in with a beer. _

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, Fras.  You've been moping around here all week. Why don't you join me at McGinty's?  It's crazy around there on Valentine's Day.  Last year McGinty hired this fat guy in a diaper to go around shooting a bow and arrow at people. No, wait.  That might have been the Super Bowl.

speaker: Frasier
text: You had me right up until "diaper," Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: You guys, you guys!  You have to see this.  Wait, wait, look: Daphne has sauce on her nose!  Is that the cutest thing you've ever seen in your life?  Wait, wait, let me get it.

speaker: Niles
text: Yumm.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've got some on your neck.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, seriously, wait.  I was going to wait 'til after dinner to tell you this, but I can't: In three hours you and I are going to be on a plane to Cancun!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I barely have time to pack!

speaker: Niles
text: It's already taken care of, Dad packed a bag for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Mr. Crane!

speaker: Daphne
text: I've never been this happy in my life!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm happier than you are!

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, somebody trying to watch "Behind the Music," here. _Niles and Daphne go back into the kitchen as the phone rings.  Frasier picks it up from the couch._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Yeah, hi, Roz.  No, no I'm not going to the benefit. Yeah, I'll bet she's got a great personality.  Yes, well, thanks anyway, Roz.  Listen, you have a good time.  Right, goodnight.

speaker: Martin
text: Roz find you a date for tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, she's going with some guy lives in her building, he's got a sister.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you oughta go.  Beats hangin' around here feeling sorry for yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please.  The only thing worse than a blind date would be a blind date on Valentine's Day.  Okay?  I couldn't imagine a worse way to spend an evening.

speaker: Niles
text: You have to see this! _He and Daphne take a spaghetti noodle and each start on one end.  They eat until they meet in the middle, a la the scene from "Lady and the Tramp."_

speaker: Niles
text: Let's get more!  Come on, come on, let's do it again!

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe Roz hasn't left yet.  The scene SLIDES to Frasier (his arm in a sling) standing in the apartment, wearing a tuxedo -- UNIVERSE 1 _

speaker: Frasier
text: It's now 7:45.  At this precise moment, she should be receiving a jeroboam of chilled champagne.

speaker: Martin
text: You're really layin' it on thick, aren't ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God, Dad, you don't know the half of it.  This morning she was awakened by a string quartet on her porch.  Then, when Monica arrived at her office, there were seven dozen roses on her desk.  A dozen for every day that I've known her.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry!

speaker: Martin
text: What happened?

speaker: Daphne
text: He's having some kind of reaction to the sauce.

speaker: Niles
text: [_scratching_] Did you put scallops in it?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nutmeg?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Martin
text: Wheat germ?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Carob?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: Cumin?

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, this is a disaster!  We have reservations to fly to Cancun tonight!

speaker: Daphne
text: Really?

speaker: Niles
text: Well we can't go now!  I can't possibly sit still on a plane for five hours with this rash you've given me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Niles, don't let a little mistake disturb the most magical evening of...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, the whole weekend is ruined!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I said I was sorry!

speaker: Niles
text: I even had Dad pack a bag for you!

speaker: Daphne
text: You did what?  You let him go through my things?  How could you?!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry!  I was trying to something nice for our first Valentine's Day!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what do you think I was trying to do?

speaker: Daphne
text: Now I'm going to have to spend the whole night rubbing lotion all over you.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry I yelled at you.

speaker: Niles
text: You have sauce on your nose.  Let me get it.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've got some on your neck. _FADE TO:  Scene Three - The Benefit Dinner Fade in. Frasier comes in with Monica._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Roz.  Where's Mike?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, he's parking the car.  Monica, what a gorgeous corsage.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, thank you.  It was a gift from Frasier.  Along with about a million roses.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hello, young lovers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Kenny, look at you.

speaker: Kenny
text: What can I say?  Under this gruff exterior beats the heart of a true romantic.  I just love love.

speaker: Roz
text: So where's your wife?

speaker: Kenny
text: She had plans.

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, Kenny, I'll buy you a drink.

speaker: Kenny
text: Great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why don't we sit down?  Here we are, let me.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was thinking perhaps, after the party, we could take a carriage ride in the park and make our way to your place where, I believe, there is a two pound box of chocolate truffles waiting for you.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, two pounds.  Wow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, your sister told me that truffles were your favorite.

speaker: Monica
text: You talked to Cheryl?  I haven't talked with her in months.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well you'll have your chance on Sunday, we're having dinner with her and Jack.

speaker: Monica
text: There's a lot of people here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes of course, I understand.  The scene SLIDES to Frasier (uninjured) entering the benefit wearing a suit and tie.  Monica and Mike are dancing just inside and kissing. Frasier glances jealously at them -- UNIVERSE 2 _

speaker: Roz
text: Hey Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.  Happy Valentine's Day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Same to you.

speaker: Roz
text: This is my date, Robert.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Robert
text: Nice to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice to meet you, too.  Well, Roz, listen, thanks for getting me out of the house.  I'd been sitting there feeling sorry for myself long enough.

speaker: Roz
text: That's the spirit!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, on the way over here, I was actually getting excited over meeting someone new.

speaker: Robert
text: Here's my sister now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Judy
text: Oh, my God!  Aarr!

speaker: Frasier
text: Aarr!

speaker: Judy
text: Aarr!

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, looks like you two already know each other.  You even have your own language.

speaker: Judy
text: It must be fate.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pained_] It must be.

speaker: Frasier
text: For you.

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, another rose.  Frasier, I appreciate everything you're doing, the flowers, the carriage ride, the "Love Is..." cartoons from the newspaper...

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just a drop in the ocean compared to what you deserve.

speaker: Emcee
text: That song was dedicated to Mr. and Mrs. Terry Craypence, celebrating their thirtieth anniversary.

speaker: Monica
text: That's so cute.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm glad to hear you say that.  You wait right here.

speaker: Monica
text: Okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good evening everybody, I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.  Normally I deal with matters of the head, but tonight I'd like to share what's in my heart.  Monica, this is for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have I a hope or half a chance, To even think that I could dance with you?  Ooh, ooh. Would you greet me or politely turn away? Would there suddenly be sunshine on a cold and rainy day? Oh, babe, what would you say?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, oh, baby I know, I know I could be so in love (congratulations) with you. And I know that I could make you love me too. And if I could hear you say the words you do, ooh, ooh. Well anyway, what would you say? _He ends up kneeling in front of Monica, the microphone in front of her.  She puts her hand over it, but when she speaks, everyone can hear._

speaker: Monica
text: Frasier, we need to talk.

speaker: Kenny
text: Ouch!

speaker: Monica
text: Don't get me wrong, Frasier.  Everything you did was nice, it was just... too much.  You made me feel like a project and not a person.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I could tone things down.  And we could start fresh. How about lunch tomorrow?  You see, I was going to say breakfast.

speaker: Monica
text: I think I should go.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well, you know, I'll get my car.

speaker: Monica
text: No, that's okay.  I'm gonna get my stuff and just take a cab. So, [_she kisses him_] bye.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm humiliated.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Frasier, no one even noticed what happened. _Kenny walks by on his way out.  He stops and pats Frasier on the shoulder._

speaker: Kenny
text: Ouch.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's my own fault, really.  I guess I just saw what Niles had and I pushed too hard to get it for myself.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, if it means anything, I thought what you did was terribly romantic.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe...

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, let me walk you to your car.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, what about Mike?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, it'll only be a few minutes, he'll be fine. _As they walk out, Monica is putting her wrap on.  She throws it over her shoulder and the end hits Mike, spilling his drink._

speaker: Monica
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I am such a klutz.

speaker: Mike
text: That's okay.  Really, it's fine.

speaker: Monica
text: Let me get you another drink.  Please, it's the least I can do.

speaker: Mike
text: I guess that'd be okay.  Mike.

speaker: Monica
text: Monica. _They shake hands, obviously taken with each other.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Frasier's BMW -- UNIVERSE 1 Fade in. Frasier is driving home and has taken his tuxedo jacket off. The radio is on. _

speaker: Announcer
text: We now return to a repeat broadcast of "The Best of Crane". Please do not call in.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_voice over from the radio_] Before the break we were talking to Phil, who's having trouble getting over a relationship. Phil, if you're listening, it might help to keep in mind the old adage: It's better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do make a good point. _The scene slides to Frasier (uninjured), also in his BMW heading home -- UNIVERSE 2 _

speaker: Frasier
text: What a load of crap.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] Let's go to our next caller.

speaker: Rachel
text: [_v.o._] Hi, this is Rachel.  I just want to let you know, I read that Thurber book you quoted, and man, is he funny!

speaker: Frasier
text: Glad you liked him.

speaker: Rachel
text: I also have a confession to make: You know, I have a big crush on you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I'm flattered, Rachel, but I make it a policy not to date my callers.

speaker: Rachel
text: [_v.o._] Well, if you ever change you mind, I'm the chef at the Columbia Street Grill.  You should come by sometime. _Frasier gets a thoughtful look in his eyes.  The scene SLIDES to the injured Frasier with the same look.  CUT TO: a long shot of Frasier's BMW at a stoplight.  The other BMW merges into it as the two worlds converge again.  Frasier pulls a u-turn at the intersection.  FADE OUT._
